courses.subject: ACCT
courses.title: Financial Instruments and Hedge Accounting
courses.description:
1. Introduce accounting recognition, derecognition, and impairment of financial instruments which include financial assets, liabilities, equity and derivatives
2. Introduce hedge accounting
3. Introduce framework of using derivatives to manage market risks such as foreign exchange risk, interest rate risk, inflation risk, equity risk and commodity risk
4. Study and discuss real-life hedging cases
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Accountancy
courses.learning_outcomes:
• Students will learn financial instruments commonly used in firms, especially in banks and other financial institutions.
• Students will learn accounting treatments, including recognition, derecognition and impairment of financial instruments.
• Students will understand derivatives and its link with risk management.
• Students will learn how to use derivatives to hedge various market risks such as foreign exchange, interest rate, inflation, equity and commodity risks.
• Students will learn accounting treatments of hedging activities.
courses.course_syllabus:
Class 1 （第一課） Classification of financial asset （金融資產的分類）
Class 2 （第二課） Classification of financial liability and equity （金融負債和權益的分類）
Class 3 （第三課） Derivatives and embedded derivatives （衍生工具和嵌入的衍生工具）
Class 4 （第四課） Recognition and derecognition of financial asset and liability （確認和終止確認金融資產和負債）
Class 5 （第五課） Impairment of financial assets （金融資產的減值損失）
Class 6 （第六課） Mid-term examination （期中考試）
Class 7 （第七課） Hedge accounting framework: Cash flow hedge, fair value hedge, and foreign operation hedge （套期會計的框架：現金流套期、公允價值套期和境外經營套期）
Class 8 （第八課） Hedging foreign exchange risk and foreign operation （對匯率風險和境外經營的套期）
Class 9 （第九課） Hedging interest rate risk （對利率的套期）
Class 10 （第十課） Hedging equity risk and stock-based compensation plans （對股權風險和股權激勵計劃的套期）
Class 11 （第十一課） Hedging commodity risk （對商品風險的套期）
Class 12 （第十二課） Hedging inflation risk （對通貨膨脹風險的套期）
Class 13 （第十三課） Final examination （期末考試）
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings: Accounting standards published by The International Accounting Standards Board (IASB)
courses.recommended_readings: Publications from IASB, FASB, PWC, KPMG, Deloitte, and Ernst & Young

courses.subject: ACCT
courses.title: Accounting and Corporate Strategies
courses.description: Making and correctly implementing business strategies are one of the most important tasks for firms’ high level management. This course aims to help students to (1) understand the relationship between their firm’s existence, development and the increasing of their firm’s value; (2) study the role of the strategic management in the development process of their firms; (3) improve students’ ability of making corporate strategies by using analytical tools; (4) improve students’ leadership capacity and the ability of implementing corporate strategy, including the communication skills between firms’ financial management and stakeholders.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Executive Master of Professional Accountancy
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of the subject, students will be able to:
a) Understand the relationship between development and value creation of a company and the role of strategic management for a company’s development
b) Make use of various kinds of tools to analyze and propose strategy
c) Enhance their capability to communicate as a financial manager with colleagues of other divisions with regard to corporate strategy
courses.course_syllabus:
- What is a strategy? Why is a strategy needed? What kind of strategy is needed? How to develop a strategy?
- Basic analysis of strategic planning
- Strategic Elements: Diamond Model
- Implementation of the strategy
- Accounting, Finance and Corporate Strategy
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings:
1. Course lecture notes
2. 迈克尔．希特、杜安．爱尔兰、罗伯特．霍斯基森，《战略管理——竞争与全球（概念）》，第12 版，赵宏霞等译，机械工业出版社
courses.recommended_readings:
1. 迈克尔．波特 (Michael E.Porter)，《竞争优势》(Competitive Advantage: Creating and Sustaining Superior Performance)，陈丽芳 (译)，中信出版社，2014 年 6 月 1 日。
2. 迈克尔．波特 (Michael E.Porter)，《竞争战略》(Competitive Strategy: Techniques for Analyzing Industries and Competitors)， 陈丽芳 (译)，中信出版社，2014 年 7 月 1 日。
3. 加里．哈默，比尔．布林著，《管理的未来》，中信出版社，2012 年 9 月第 2 版。
4. 戴维．贝赞可 (David Besanko)，《战略经济学（第五版）》(Economics of Strategy)，中国人民大学出版社，2015 年 2 月 1 日。
5. 菲利普．科特勒、凯文．莱恩．凯勒，《营销管理（第15版．彩色版）》，何佳讯 (译)，格致出版社，2016年 8 月 1 日。
6. W．钱．金 (作者)，勒妮．莫博涅《蓝海战略：超越产业竞争，开创全新市场（扩展版）》(Blue Ocean Strategy How to Create Uncontested Market Space and Make the Competition Irrelevant)，吉宓 (译)，商务印书馆，2016 年 4 月 1 日。
7. 劳伦斯．弗里德曼，《战略：一部历史》(Oxford University Press 2013)，王坚、马娟娟译，社会科学文献出版社，2013 年。
8. Chris Anderson，《长尾理论：为什么商业的未来是小众市场》(The Long Tail: Why The Future of Business is Selling Less of More)，第四版，中信出版集团股份有限公司，2015 年 8 月 1 日。
9. 曾鸣著，《智能商业》，中信出版社，2018 年 11 月第 1 版。

courses.subject: ACCT
courses.title: Managerial Economics and Business Strategy for Accounting Managers
courses.description: Rational and foresight business strategies will help firms to succeed in a competitive market, and to strengthen their capability to develop continuously. This course is based on the basic theory and framework of Managerial Economics, particularly designed for CFO, through easy and readable language and business cases, introducing and demonstrating the heart of Managerial Economics to help CFOs to make successful business strategies.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Executive Master of Professional Accountancy
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of the subject, students will be able to:
a) Sort out the crucial elements for decision-making from a complex context of business
b) Understand the basic principles of game theory and how these principles could be applied
c) Think from the opponents perspectives in order to make the best strategy which may ultimately be conducive to a win-win situation for all stakeholders
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Introduction to Game Theory
2. Simultaneous game
3. Infinite repetition game
4. Limited repeated game
5. Multi-stage game
6. Game application under asymmetric information
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings:
• Lecture Notes
• 《妙趣横生博弈论》，阿维纳什．迪克西特（Michael R. Baye），机械工业出版社
• 《博弈与社会讲义》，张维迎，北京大学出版社

courses.subject: ACCT
courses.title: Independent Study in Accounting
courses.description: Independent study gives students added flexibility to design study programmes suited to a particular area of interest or to delve more deeply into a specific topic. Students need to find a faculty member willing to serve as the supervisor, and together, devise a format. There are a wide range of possibilities under independent study. The more common alternatives are: (a) Selection of a topic not normally covered in our curriculum in which the student has an interest. Normally the student would prepare a literature review on the selected topic. It would then be common for the student to perform some application or extension of this body of knowledge by extending or substantiating that knowledge by some data collection. (b) Preparation of a case and accompanying teacher’s note. The case must be based on real organizations and substantial data collection would be expected. The student would be expected to demonstrate application of theory in preparation of the teacher’s note.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in Master of Accountancy
courses.learning_outcomes: Independent study gives students added flexibility to delve deeply into a selected topic as agreed by a professor. After completing this course, students will be able to: (1) Have an enhanced understanding of a topic not normally covered in our curriculum in which the student has an interest; (2) Have a better understanding of how to carry out an academic research, i.e., preparing literature review; forming hypotheses; extending knowledge via data collection; and, analyzing and interpreting the results; (3) Write a proper research or case report; and (4) Demonstrate a proper application of theory to examine hypothesis.
courses.course_syllabus: Independent study gives students added flexibility to delve deeply into a selected topic as agreed by a professor. After completing this course, students will be able to: (1) Have an enhanced understanding of a topic not normally covered in our curriculum in which the student has an interest; (2) Have a better understanding of how to carry out an academic research, i.e., preparing literature review; forming hypotheses; extending knowledge via data collection; and, analyzing and interpreting the results; (3) Write a proper research or case report; and (4) Demonstrate a proper application of theory to examine hypothesis.

courses.subject: ACCT
courses.title: Issues in Financial Accounting
courses.description: Current research topics in financial accounting. These include accounting information and capital market behaviour, the economic consequences of both mandatory and voluntarily public announcements made by firms, effects of agency costs and debt convenants on the behaviour of firms’ reporting choices, fundamental analysis of accounting data, compensation schemes and financial reporting.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Accountancy
courses.learning_outcomes:
By completion of the course, students will be able to:
L1: Master basic financial accounting theories
L2: Develop a good understanding of the evolution of financial accounting research
L3: Develop basic computing skills in empirical accounting research
L4: Fluently communicate research ideas in a well-structured approach
L5: Assess the validity of research work in financial accounting
L6: Develop a basic work framework for generating new research ideas
courses.course_syllabus:
Empirical financial accounting topics focusing on capital markets and the use of accounting information in various contracting settings:

1. Introduction and basic earnings-stock price relationship

2. Properties of accounting numbers

3. Measuring earnings characteristics

4. Early life-cycle: pre-IPO, IPO

5. Bankruptcy

6. Disclosure

7. Litigation

8. Auditors

9. Financial analysts

10. Corporate social responsibility

11. Social media

12. International issues

courses.recommended_readings:
* Teaching materials to be provided by the course lecturer(s).
* To be provided by course instructor.

courses.subject: ACCT
courses.title: Independent Study
courses.description: The purpose of this course is to expose graduate students to special topics not otherwise covered. Prior to taking this course, students should submit a proposal to and get approval from the instructor-in-charge stating the purposes and major objectives of their study. Details regarding how the study will be conducted are decided through consultation with their instructor-in-charge. The instructor may also ask the students to write reports throughout the semester, for example, a mid-course progress report and an end-of-course final report. This course requires research which is not a significant duplication of the thesis.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Accountancy
courses.learning_outcomes:
By completion of the course, students will be able to:
L1: Master basic theoretical concepts in accounting research
L2: Develop a good understanding of the evolution of accounting research
L3: Assess the validity of research work
L4: Critique accounting research by applying basic accounting theories
L5: Develop a basic work framework for generating new research ideas in a special accounting topic
courses.course_syllabus: No exact syllabus but the topic should not be a significant duplication of the student’s thesis
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory course and teaching evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings: To be provided by the course teacher

courses.subject: ACCT
courses.title: Issues in Managerial Accounting
courses.description: Current research topics in managerial accounting. These include analysis of information values, theory of syndicates and teams; organization form and hierarchy, advanced topics in cost allocations and transfer pricing, decision models in management accounting, management accounting for multi-national corporations, agency issues in executive contracts, contingency theory and design of management accounting systems, behavioural dimensions of management accounting.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Accountancy
courses.learning_outcomes:
By completion of the course, students will be able to:
L1: Master basic managerial accounting theories
L2: Develop a good understanding of the evolution of managerial accounting research
L3: Develop basic modelling skills in theoretical accounting research
L4: Fluently communicate research ideas in a well-structured approach
L5: Assess the validity of research work in managerial accounting
L6: Develop a basic work framework for generating new research ideas in managerial accounting
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Introduction to management accounting research

2. Management control systems

3. Interfirm relations

4. Performance goals and targets

5. Tournament incentives

6. Non-cash rewards

7. Performance measurement

8. Subjectivity and discretion

9. Implicit incentives and norms

10. Feedback, personnel and cultural controls, recognition

courses.required_readings: To be provided by the course teacher

courses.subject: ACCT
courses.title: Research Methodology in Accounting
courses.description: The course is designed to equip students with skills necessary for advanced research in accounting areas. Topics covered will include identification of research problems, development of research hypotheses, research design, data collection and processing, statistical tests, interpretation of results, and writing of research reports. Selected papers and topical research issues will also be discussed. The emphasis will be on the application of the research methods to solving accounting-related problems.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Accountancy
courses.learning_outcomes:
By completion of the course, students will be able to:
L1: Master basic accounting research methodologies
L2: Assess the validity of methodologies adopted by accounting research work
L3: Determine the appropriate methodologies of various accounting research questions
L4: Understand the main critiques for various accounting methodologies
L5: Apply the main methodologies properly in own research questions.
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Organizational Meeting and Introduction Modeling Information and its Use

2. Basic Moral Hazard and Adverse Selection Problems

3. Moral Hazard and Corporate Agency Costs

4. Moral Hazard and Financing Constraint

5. Moral Hazard and Monitoring in Teams

6. Adverse Selection and Voluntary Disclosure

7. Adverse Selection and Disclosure for Investment Eﬃciency

8. Adverse Selection and Disclosure for Liquidity Eﬃciency

courses.title: Current Topics in Accounting Research
courses.description: The course explores current topics in a specific area of accounting research. Through a combination of lectures and seminars, students discuss recent literature and academic works to enhance their knowledge and skill to conduct research in accounting utilizing tools and paradigms at the frontier of such technologies.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Accountancy
courses.learning_outcomes:
By completion of the course, students will be able to:
L1: Master basic theoretical concepts in accounting research
L2: Develop a good understanding of the evolution of accounting research
L3: Assess the validity of research work
L4: Critique accounting research by applying basic accounting theories
L5: Develop basic understanding of the common methodologies used in accounting research
courses.course_syllabus:

2. Apply the theories and methodologies to topics including firm ownership and organizational structures, state owned firms, family firms, and corporate accounting. financing, and governance decisions
